column4: is there any way to force all of my computer's network traffic (including apt) to go through a proxy? I know how to do it on an application by application basis
Set up it as a transparent proxy?
I'll look up about transparent proxies, thanks
But for what reason are you trying to do that?
well mainly seems more secure when I'm on an untrusted wireless connection
I highly doubt it.
If the proxy doesn't use encryption, then it adds exactly zero security.
well I'm using ssh to connect to my home PC.
ssh has an option to create a very simple VPN.
I'll read about that too, anyways
That's what a VPN does.
You can try setting up OpenVPN, or using the tun device support in ssh, or something else.
6 only gives read/write permissions, but not execute. Which means, the directory will _never_ be accessible.
So, you sure you didn't mean 700 and 777?
err, yes that's what I meant :-)
Anyway, for a directory to be accessed, you must have +x perms for all its parents.
ok, that's what I was making sure. thank you :-)
xclip -in -selection clipboard
ah didn't realize I had to change the selection, thanks
Remember that X11 has several separate 'selections'. The 'primary' selection is updated when you select some text - middle-click to paste. The 'clipboard' is updated when you press Ctrl-C.
yea, that's new to me, so I'll have to read about it, thank you very much
